thread.title: Umpqua Community College shooter was enrolled in class targeted, deputies say
thread.title_full: Umpqua Community College shooter was enrolled in class targeted, deputies say | OregonLive.com

author: Everton Bailey Jr. | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Umpqua Community College shooter was enrolled in class targeted, deputies say
text:
The Douglas County Sheriff's Office has confirmed 26-year-old Christopher Sean Harper-Mercer of Winchester as the gunman who fatally shot nine people and wounded another nine at Umpqua Community College on Thursday.
Harper-Mercer was enrolled in the college class where the shooting occurred, the sheriff's office said. He died after a shootout with police on the campus.
Authorities announced Friday that Harper-Mercer carried five handguns and a variation of an AR-15 to the Roseburg-based campus Thursday morning. Police also found a flak jacket with steel plates lying beside the rifle and five magazines of ammunition.
Seven more firearms and other ammunition were found at his Winchester home, according to Celinez Nunez, U.S. Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms and Explosives assistant special agent in charge.
Either Harper-Mercer or his relatives legally bought the 13 weapons within the last three years, Nunez said.
Harper-Mercer's half-sister told The Oregonian/OregonLive in an email that she had no answers for why the shooting occurred.
"I do not condone his actions, but he was my brother, I loved him and we ask that you let us grieve as well," wrote Anntionet Day. "My heart is bleeding for the victims and their families and I ask that we as a nation honor them by dismissing the attention Chris sought so it is understood that these horrid acts will not be glorified."
Mark Friesen | The Oregonian/OregonLive Douglas County Sheriff John Hanlin has repeatedly said he would not utter the name of the suspect , saying he believed identifying him publicly could inspire similar tragedies.
Umpqua Community College has been closed since the shooting. School officials said the campus will reopen Monday, but classes will be canceled through Friday, Oct. 9.
The sheriff's office released the names of the nine people killed in the campus shooting, including an Umpqua Community College teacher, an aspiring pediatric nurse, a cousin of an Oregon senator and others who were in their first week of college:
- Quinn Glen Cooper , 18, of Roseburg
- Rebecka Ann Carnes , 18, of Myrtle Creek
- Lucas Eibel , 18, of Roseburg
- Lucero Alcaraz , 19, of Roseburg
- Treven Taylor Anspach , 20, of Sutherlin
- Jason Dale Johnson , 33, of Winston
- Sarena Dawn Moore , 44, of Myrtle Creek
- Kim Saltmarsh Dietz , 59, of Roseburg
- Lawrence Levine , 67, of Glide
An Army veteran shot while charging Harper-Mercer is among those wounded and recovering in area hospitals. An online fundraiser for Chris Mintz has collected nearly $400,000 from more than 12,000 donors in 10 hours.
Maxine Bernstein, Laura Gunderson and Andrew Theen of The Oregonian/OregonLive staff contributed to this report.
-- Everton Bailey Jr.
ebailey@oregonian.com
